security_audit.summary: This skill consists solely of markdown documentation containing UI/UX design guidelines and operational procedures. No executable code, scripts, network access, file system operations, or external command capabilities were detected.

content.value_statement: Design consistency and accessibility issues frustrate users and hurt product adoption. This skill provides structured guidelines and checklists for implementing user-centered, accessible, and consistent UI/UX across applications.
actual_capabilities: Apply user-centered design principles to feature requests
Create consistent design patterns across applications
Design responsive layouts for multiple screen sizes
Define design systems with components, colors, and typography
limitations: Does not generate actual design assets or mockups
Does not validate color contrast programmatically
Does not integrate with design tools like Figma
Does not provide usability testing services

use_cases.title: Define design requirements
use_cases.description: Establish clear UX requirements and success criteria for new features and products

use_cases.title: Build consistent components
use_cases.description: Create reusable UI components that follow established design system patterns

use_cases.title: Audit design quality
use_cases.description: Review existing interfaces for consistency, accessibility, and user experience issues

prompt_templates.title: Basic design review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the following interface description and identify UX issues based on user-centered design principles

prompt_templates.title: Accessibility check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this component or flow for WCAG compliance issues and suggest specific improvements

prompt_templates.title: Design system setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Define a design system for this application including components, colors, typography, and spacing rules

prompt_templates.title: Responsive design plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Plan a responsive design strategy for this feature including breakpoints and adaptive layouts

output_examples.input: Review a login form design and suggest improvements
output: Add inline validation feedback as users type in each field
Include a password visibility toggle icon
Ensure error messages explain the problem and suggest a fix
Add proper ARIA labels for screen readers
Use sufficient color contrast (4.5:1 minimum) for all text

best_practices: Start design reviews by identifying the primary user goals and tasks
Validate all interactive elements with keyboard navigation before release
Document design decisions and rationale in a shared design system
anti_patterns: Using inconsistent button styles or interaction patterns across screens
Failing to provide feedback during long-running operations
Hiding critical error messages or using vague error messages

faq.question: Which AI tools is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides design guidance through natural language prompts.

faq.question: What design standards does this skill follow?
faq.answer: It references WCAG 2.1 guidelines for accessibility and general user-centered design principles.

faq.question: Can this skill create design mockups or prototypes?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides guidelines and text-based recommendations. It does not generate visual design files.

faq.question: Is any user data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No, this skill is purely advisory. It does not access, store, or transmit any user data.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my existing design system?
faq.answer: Use the skill to review your patterns against guidelines. Adapt recommendations to match your component library.

faq.question: How is this different from coding assistants?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on design quality and user experience rather than code implementation.
